TopicTitle: potentially shady mod on space dock (might be breaking licenses and does not provide source code or much info on what exactly the mod entails) (would not recomend downloading this so do not)

Articles.Content:
https://spacedock.info/mod/3012/Futurism#info     Am I crazy here or is this mod breaking licenses of other mods and also being shady with the licenses it uses while claiming to be a mod pack (we don't know what mods are in it) also instead of granting credit to the mods it uses it just says "

Credits to everyone who made these mods, I can't be bothered to list them all here"

 

 

Edited June 6, 2022 by TheLoneOne
extra info
I've reached out to the two mod devs whose ARR mods are included, to let them know.

12 hours ago, Stone Blue said:

I've reached out to the two mod devs whose ARR mods are included, to let them know.

ive already reached out to space dck's support too informing them of this.

did a little digging.

all the mods in the pack are -

- ASET

-Benjee_MMSEV

-Benjee_sharedAssets

-HonkHogan

-J_JAR

-Kermantech

-KSA

-Moardv

-RESCALE (all in caps, yes)

-ScattererAtmosphereCache

-Sigma

-SigmaDimensions

-VexarpIVA

 

+ something called NF spacecraft, if it Near Future Spacecraft, its only a few of the configs, no DDS images, as far as i can see

Can someone identify if this is sus?

59 minutes ago, TheLoneOne said:

but thats weird it says he added airplanes plus but its clearly not there

That mod is in the .ckan file that contains the majority of the mods in the pack. The bundled mods are only the ones that the uploader thought (wrongly, in some cases) were not in CKAN.

1 hour ago, HebaruSan said:

That mod is in the .ckan file that contains the majority of the mods in the pack. The bundled mods are only the ones that the uploader thought (wrongly, in some cases) were not in CKAN.

thank you for the info, (to clarify though its still shady and an issue clearly due to violating license's and all that but that clears that part up)
quick question, what happens if you break a license? He also says they are not on CKAN, theres a text file whihc says so. Thats just a little contradictory

53 minutes ago, TKMK said:

quick question, what happens if you break a license? He also says they are not on CKAN, theres a text file whihc says so. Thats just a little contradictory

The text file is a list of mods to add, to make the pack, which *ARE* on ckan... you can use that file to download/install the mods from ckan.
the ones in the folders that are included, are the ones *NOT* on ckan...

ah ha.

and what about licensing. is your mod just removed, or something more serious.

21 hours ago, TKMK said:

ah ha.

and what about licensing. is your mod just removed, or something more serious.

Technically the license is a contract where the original content author expresses how they wish their work to be distributed. Not obeying the license is at the very least morally dubious and depending on what country you live in may be illegal. Some countries are much stricter about copyright/licensing violations than others. Failing to follow the licensing terms could also be a breach of the rules of conduct on many KSP community web sites. The modding community is built largely on a web of trust that author's work and rights will be respected.

19 hours ago, Aelfhe1m said:

Technically the license is a contract where the original content author expresses how they wish their work to be distributed. Not obeying the license is at the very least morally dubious and depending on what country you live in may be illegal. Some countries are much stricter about copyright/licensing violations than others. Failing to follow the licensing terms could also be a breach of the rules of conduct on many KSP community web sites. The modding community is built largely on a web of trust that author's work and rights will be respected.

however this license tells people it's okay to do that even though mods within it say basically the opposite.

Yeaahhh... unfortunately, its up to the material owner/licensee to pursue license violations on their material.

Which usually takes $$ for research, fees, court costs & *lawyers*.... Hobbyists usually dont have those inds of resources, so many violations cant/wont be pursued...

Unfortunately, licensing your material, is lie putting a padlock on your garage door... If someone is *determined* to get in there, it wont take much, so a padlock is really only there to keep honest people honest... Doesnt do much for determined criminals

2 hours ago, TheLoneOne said:

however this license tells people it's okay to do that even though mods within it say basically the opposite.

This is the worrying part.

As far as I understand, this is misrepresentation. A completely different beast that can bite in completely different ways.

I don't use spacedock beyond anonymously reading from there. Does the site have a function "report this mod for doing bad things (copyright, virus, etc)" for logged in users? If yes those of you with accounts should report that mod.

@TheLoneOne Consider editing your post so it's not a direct link to the bad actor, to avoid giving it extra traffic.
